com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.tone_analyzer.v1
Class ToneAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.service.WatsonService
      com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.tone_analyzer.v1.ToneAnalyzer

public class ToneAnalyzer
extends WatsonService

The IBM Watson The Tone Analyzer service uses linguistic analysis to detect emotional tones, social propensities, and writing styles in written communication. Then it offers suggestions to help the writer improve their intended language tones.

Version:
v1
Author:
German Attanasio Ruiz (germanatt@us.ibm.com)
See Also:
Tone Analyzer

Method Detail

getTone

public Tone getTone(String text)
Analyzes the "tone" of a piece of text using the default scorecard. The message is analyzed from several tones (social tone, emotional tone, writing tone), and for each of them various traits are derived (such as conscientiousness, agreeableness, openness).

Parameters:
text - The text to analyze
Returns:
the Tone with the response

getTone

public Tone getTone(String text,
                    Scorecard scorecard)
Analyzes the "tone" of a piece of text. The message is analyzed from several tones (social tone, emotional tone, writing tone), and for each of them various traits are derived (such as conscientiousness, agreeableness, openness).

Parameters:
text - The text to analyze
scorecard - Name of the scorecard used to compute the tone. (business messages by default)
Returns:
the Tone with the response

getSynonyms

public List<SynonymResult> getSynonyms(Map<String,Object> params)
Starts or continue conversations.

Parameters:
words - (string[]),
traits - (string[], optional),
limit - (long, optional) Limits the number of words to return on each trait. The most heavily correlated (positive and negative) to each trait are returned; approximately limit/2 each of positively correlated words negatively correlated words if there are enough available.
hops - (long, optional): The number of 'hops' to explore for synonyms or related words: 0 indicates words directly related to the input; 1 gives words related to them, and so on. The greater this number, the richer the word set returned (but at the same time, less tightly related to the input).
context - (string[], optional)
index - (long, optional): The position (0-based) in `context` parameter where the requested word appears. This parameter can only be passed when `context` is also present and there is only one word requested (length(`words`)=0), and it makes sense only if `context[index]` is equal to `words[0]`.
params - The map with the parameters described above
Returns:
SynonymResult
